abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows; Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is highly likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            highly satisfactory. Some key lessons cited from the project
            were: 1) The establishment of a strongly staffed, and well
            managed PIU and PCC led to project success. 2) Adequate
            project duration should be set. 3) The personnel from
            supporting agencies (other ministries) should become more
            familiar with the various Bank guidelines and documentation
            requirements. 4) Local administrators, coordinators and
            teachers should be more fully briefed regarding the
            advantages of participating in the project as well as their
            responsibilities. 5) Systematic monitoring and evaluation
            (M&E) is critical. 6) Lack of cohesion among technical
            consultants may cause delays in construction, lack of
            architectural control over the project, and a lack of
            articulation between various plans and specifications. 7)
            Teachers were more responsive to changes and innovations
            when they participated in a continuous professional
            development model of in-service training. 8) Overseas,
            long-term training should only be done when local training
            capacity is not available. 9) In large scale staff
            development programs, ensure that specific selection
            criteria are well established, and that the subsequent
            selection process closely follows the established criteria.
            10) Government assignment of currently employed, MOE staff
            to the project for the duration helped to turnover of hired
            technical staff Also, the selection and assignment of
            multiple understudies to each technical staff provided some
            redundancy when key staff resigned; Other lessons concerned
            management information systems development and curriculum/
            pedagogical development.

            Assistance Strategy, the Social Sector Support Project, the

            Technical Assistance Project for Malaysia.

TF036673-SOUTH EAST ASIA REGION -
            EDUCATION PROJECTS (VIETNAM AND CAMBODIA)

abstracts.cdata!:
The Education Sector Support Project
            follows the sector objectives of the Country Assistance
            Strategy (CAS) dated March 1999, and will assist the
            Government in restoring expenditure priorities in education.
            The CAS highlights the need for improved skills in science,
            mathematics, and information technology. The development
            objectives of the project address the negative effects of
            the economic downturn on the education sector, and assist in
            the medium-term economic recovery, through the development
            of cost-effective technical skills. The main components of
            the project include: 1) The improvement of basic education
            through capacity expansion and staff development, including
            the construction of schools, equipment supply, and teacher
            training/upgrading at various leveles. 2) The capacity
            expansion of the polytechnic system enrollment, and the
            quality enhancement of its training programs. This also
            includes construction, equipment supply, staff training,
            curriculumdevelopment, and polytechnica management and
            management systems improvement. 3) Support to the Ministry
            of Education (MOE) through development plans for
            institutional strengthening consisting of computer supply,
            technical assistance, and training for multiple databases
            integration; MOE staff development plans; institutional and
            staff development plans for higher education; and project
            management assistance for MOE staff.
